intro: Aulonemia haenkei, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. Aulonemia haenkei is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its rapid growth and ability to spread through seeds make it a common weed in agricultural and garden settings.
